name: tetragonal
content:

of or relating to the shape of a crystal in which two of three axes of each crystal are of the same length and all three axes form right angles: Some of the larger crystals are elongate, which gives them a tetragonal rather than cubic appearance. When heated from room temperature, the crystals change to show tetragonal symmetry.
More examplesFewer examplesTwo crystal forms were obtained; one had tetragonal symmetry, and the second had hexagonal symmetry.The symmetry of the tetragonal system requires the crystal to have three axes, with two of them equal in length and the third axis either longer or shorter than the other two.
